name: Gansevoort Park Avenue NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now stayed here on 4 separate occasions and love this hotel.The rooms are spacious and quiet, the beds large and comfortable and the bathrooms well appointed. The roof top pool and bar is a great place to relax. The whole place has a cool, sexy vibe and staff has always taken very good care of us, especially Julia. I could not recommend this hotel more highly.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: it was my first stay at this wonderful hotel and it was absolutely great!
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Nice lobby with cool furniture. We had a Grand Deluxe Room facing Park Ave and it was large with super comfortable beds. Loved the decor in the room. Heard no noise in our room - slept like babies. Great bathroom with tub. The staff were super friendly and service minded. Asellina is a really good and trendy restaurant. Free WiFi all over.
reviews.title: Clean Large Rooms for NYC standards!

reviews.text: Location is great. You can walk down to Union Square in 10 minutes or uptown. Nice store across the the street with food, drinks, coffe etc.
reviews.title: Fab hang-out

reviews.text: Loved the hotel and looking forward to my next visit
reviews.title: Would give it above average but below very good...

reviews.text: Loved everything about the hotel - my room was spacious, clean and comfortable. I felt very relaxed and have rarely slept so well on a holiday.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had an end room, so had no passing traffic, so heard no noise at all when sleeping.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAY! EXCEPTIONAL STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually thought the hotel was a great location - I liked that it was in an area where normal people lived. I walked everywhere (two exceptions - cab home from the theatre and a cab to Battery Park one morning) - from 5th Avenue, Times Square, Central Park, but when just going to a walk I preferred to head south to Chelsea/Union Square area.
reviews.title: great hotel for couples and friends.

reviews.text: I ate in the hotel one night when I was tired and cold and it was delish ! I didn't make it up to the pool and bar ... I actually forgot about it.
reviews.title: Excellent Service and attentive staff

reviews.text: This one a most delightful stay. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to book one night at the GAnsevoort. Everything was perfect. The staff was incredibly friendly and payed attention to detail, the room was decorated simply but elegantly, clean (missing a full length mirror but this did not matter to us). The pool was perfect and the location is prime.
reviews.title: Location, location, location... and comfort

reviews.text: Stayed at the Gansevoort Park Avenue for a get together with high school girlfriends. We booked a suite, which had a separate bedroom and two full baths. Room was modern, beautifully appointed and spotless. Good location with easy access to various areas in Manhattan. The service, though, really sets it apart, in a good way. The staff was accommodating and very, very friendly. Would like to come back with the family. Strongly recommend.
reviews.title: Fabulous new hotel with exceptional rooms, good location and great service.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Gansevoort Hotel for 5 nights in April. The roof top bar is great, the restaurant is cool & our room had a great view of the Empire State Building But the very best thing about this hotel is Michael & his team on the front desk. They helped us with everything we needed & gave us tips on how to enjoy the city as a local. We have been to NYC 5 times now & would not consider another hotel. Well done Michael keep up the good work.....
reviews.title: best welcome in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed at Gansevoort Park for a quick weekend trip to NY City. The room we stayed in was spectacular and very cool! Could not of asked for anything more! Great experience. We will be visiting again.
reviews.title: Spectacular Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking to spend time at a hotel with a lot of nightlife and then retreat to an amazingly beautiful and relaxing room, stay here! This is a place to be seen and if you're staying at the hotel you can laugh your way past the line of people trying to get to the rooftop pool and bar. The hotel is located in a great area of Manhattan, easily accesible by subway and only a short walk away from Madison Square Park, shopping on 5th Avenue, and some of the best restaurants in the city. The one negative about the hotel is that due to its night time popularity there will be a ton of patrons outside smoking and congregating. Also, our suite, which had an insane wrap around terrace, had more then a few matches, cigarette butts, napkins, and yes a pill bottle on it in the morning from the roof. The hotel needs to get a better handle on this as people are spending good money to stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: A Whole Lot of Flash and A Whole Lot of Comfort

reviews.text: I arrived at the Gansevoort on a Saturday evening at 5pm, straight off the plane from the UK so feeling quite weary. On check in the clerk informs me that the hotel is overbooked so I have been,,,,,, DOWNGRADED! Excellent - ensuring I feel completely unwelcomed and in my place. To tired to argue I go up to the tiny room, very noisy, only one bedside table on the wrong side of the bed for me, poor lighting and no chair to sit in and read my book.
reviews.title: Making customers feel worthless

reviews.text: Stayed here in September 2012 for business.
reviews.title: New favorite in NYC
Truly magnificant and "SIMPLY THE BEST!!!"
reviews.text: The check-in staff were very friendly and told me all about the hotels amenities, including a "bar anywhere you look"...which definitely turned out to be the case...there are 6 maybe?

The room was massive by any standard, not just for NYC...I don't think I was upgraded but it was definitely large enough to have a party in...maybe that's why they have a "no more than 4 people per room" rule. The bathroom was large enough to have a massive yet chic sink...with his and her ends, and a large shower and separate bath tub. The view looked onto another building but I'm not complaining. The only thing I could complain about was a slight stale smell in the room, but not enough to bother me. No noise in my room either...so got some good sleep.
reviews.title: Modern fun

reviews.text: The rooftop bar was very fun, and we spent a fun evening up there talking to the friendly (and very attractive) staff members. The place is absolutely bumping on the weekends, which is a positive. We didn't get to try the restaurants or room service, but the resto looked especially nice.
reviews.title: Sophisticated Comfort in Midtown

reviews.text: The location is near the Flatiron building, and in a trendy part of town with lots of bars and restaurants around. Its close to several subway lines, so it makes it easy to get around town.
reviews.title: Best of the best...

reviews.text: Like its sister hotel in the Meatpacking district, this hotel very much airs on the hip and cool. A great Italian Restaurant, Rooftop Pool & Bar Scene and stunning views of the city (especially from the upper floors). As with hotels that concentrate on the nightlife aspect, the rooms are a little disappointing. Certainly smart, spacious (which is a plus in New York) and with everything you could possible need - but the decor is a little cheap and corporate (you would have thought that they would have pushed the boundaries more). However, this downside is compensated with great staff and service - all are incredibly friendly and helpful. There is also a great gym and spa (with lots of classes). The hotel is also in a wonderful central location in the city.
reviews.title: Hip & Centrally Located

reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at the Gansevoort park! The room, food, and drinks were amazing but what I liked the most was the friendly and helpful staff. Melissa, one of the young ladies from the front desk specifically stood out because of her welcoming smile and willingness to help. Thank you soo much Melissa, you rock!
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This highly rated hotel was so not right for my husband and me last month. The room had many strikes against it: The only art work in the room were photos of a scantily clad young woman, a lot of counter space was covered with products to purchase, including full size bottles of booze, the bathroom had a very low counter with a huge trough sink taking up most of it, little room to put toiletries, toilet roll holder released roll each time it was used, the shower curtain needed replacing, the TV remote was missing, every time a door slammed down the hall, our door and front wall shook, and most importantly, there is no soundproofing of the walls. The room next door was filled with partiers until all hours of the night. We could hear every word. The concierge services were not always available. Only occasionally welcomed upon entering this boutique hotel. Needless to say, we will not be returning.
reviews.title: For Young Guys Only?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hello, we stayed 3 nights over this hotel due to its good rating via trip advisor.
reviews.title: Too noisy

reviews.text: however, we were sort of disappointed in varirous reasons
reviews.title: Swanky hotel with great service

reviews.text: If you like to party hard and let it all hang out then this Hotel is for you. If you don't mind drunken revellers in and around the foyer, lifts and entrance ways you'll love the Ganesvoort Park. It's got razzle and dazzle but needs a lot more polish eg. some lobby staff need more lessons in customer service.
reviews.title: Beware the Razzle Dazzle

reviews.text: The room was clean and the beds very comfy but our desk was cluttered with a ridiculous amount of non complimentary drinks, snacks, alcohol, etc. On check out we were told we could not have a printed copy of our hotel room charges and subsequently we were then charged for items that we did not use..!!
reviews.title: Great hotel & service, average location

reviews.text: On the upside the Gansevoort Park has a lovely rooftop pool area and bar that has a great vibe. The restaurant Asellina serves yummy food although it was a little on the pricier side but we received excellent service.
reviews.title: Hip and Fun!

reviews.text: Location is in a great area with fabulous restaurants nearby, the subway a few steps away and the Empire State and Macy's only a quick 10 min walk.
reviews.title: Pretty place, but sub-par service

reviews.text: First time visitors to NYC should take the location of their hotel of choice very seriously. Friends had recommended that I stay elsewhere (based on my likes/dislikes) but I ignored them, much to my eventual disappointment.
reviews.title: This hotel = way more than the rocking pool bar

reviews.text: A great new hotel if you like the non-stop beat of club music in the lobby. The room is stayed in was extremely comfortable, well designed and very quiet. 24 hrs. access to the gym is a great plus. Food, service and staff were all excellent and I would return on my next visit to NYC.
reviews.title: Too much like South Beach

reviews.text: Beware of making reservations at this hotel. I decided to check out this hotel prior to my reservation to ask the food & beverage manager if his restaurant could accommodate my need for a soft diet after having had oral surgery.
reviews.title: Poor Front Desk & Odd Suite configuration

reviews.text: The Lobby: The music was blaring and was the type you might hear in a spinning or zoomba class at a fitness club. It was not relaxing or serene at all. And while there I requested to see a room. I made the request at 3:30 p.m. when most hotels have not yet had their new guests check in but rooms are clean and ready. The front desk at first refused stating that there was absolutely nothing to show me. I had to become quite insistent and then was told that indeed there were two rooms to show me, just not the configuration the same as that of my reservation. I said fine. The person who took me to the rooms refused to allow me to see the first room. Her reason was that it was not representative of my reservation! I thought that had already been discussed. I saw the second room. It was a one bedroom suite. The living room was tiny. The bedroom was tiny. The bathroom had no bathtub. Upon questioning about no bathtub I was told that none of the rooms were guaranteed with a bathtub. The shower had no handheld, being just a basic shower head. The air did seem fresh in the room, though. The following day, I looked this hotel up on Expedia because my reservation was through it. I wanted to see if there were reviews that reflected my experience. It turns out that this hotel has been dropped by Expedia. This is not a good sign at all for travelers.
reviews.title: Everything a woman business travelor can possibly need

reviews.text: I had the good fortune to be put up at the Gansevoort Park Avenue for a week in May 2011.
reviews.title: New Kid on the Block is well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was traveling alone, and was extremely tired and busy, and the hotel made it so much easier for me to accomplish all I needed to do. The staff was amazingly helpful in all ways.
reviews.title: If I ever stay in Manhattan again, it will be at Gansevoort Park!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 4 nights in late May at the Gansevoort Park Avenue Hotel. When we entered the lobby, I feared it was too hip for us (ages 58 and 62), but the staff was welcoming and genuinely nice (unlike in some NYC hotels, where you feel they're doing you a favor to let you stay with them). The room was large and well appointed. I especially liked the bedside lighting, which included a small halogen reading lamp above each side of the bed. We ate one breakfast in the hotel dining room; it was delicious, but on the expensive side (although comparable to other NYC hotel restaurant prices). The location was perfect, within walking distance of many of the restaurants we wanted to try. We will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Chic hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We stayed in this beautifully appointed hotel in New York and everything was perfect except for the room service. After we returned from an evening movie we decided to order room service and were told 30 minutes or less, I had to call twice 40 minutes and 57 minutes after the order was placed. One hour later the waiter arrived with everything but the drinks he did not have a table to transport the food so we waited and received our drinks when the diner was finished. When I was asked by the front desk about my stay I mentionned the issue and I was told when you come next we will organize something. This is a first for me to be told that instead of the apologies with some sort of compensation via a discount. None of the above happened and I did not really have the time to ask for a manager, however, I do hope he reads this email as I will think twice when I return to order food service, by the way the food was superb the best room service food I ever had.
reviews.title: Exquisite hotel with some issue with room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I escaped to NY for a week and chose to stay at the Gansevoort Park Avenue. The front desk agent was very friendly and attentive. We had a smooth check in since our key package was ready upon our arrival. Once at the room, it was specious with a view to the Empire State from the balcony. The restroom was well-lite with a glass shower and an awesome bath tub which we soaked in almost daily after walking all day doing all the sightseeing places. Grand Central station is not too far for a nice walk or we took the subway which was just a block or so away from the hotel. The hotel location is great since it is a short walk to the subway or short distance tax drives to many places around. Whenever we need a taxi, the bellman was quick to get it for us. We had a chance to meet our housekeeping attendant one morning and her big smile was contagious. She did a great job to keep our room nice, clean and organized. Overall whenever I go back to NY, this is the place where I will stay again and again…
reviews.title: Service oriented, friendly staff, and specious room…

reviews.text: Stayed here for the second time yesterday. The rooms are spacious and quiet, the decor is chic, and the staff is professional and fast. The location is also good and the pricing is reasonable for Manhattan. This may well be the best deal in Manhattan for upper-mid market business travel. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Nothing But Praise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing hotel - just perfect! Decor was fabulous, rooms were really spacious (that's a huge plus for NYC), and the rooftop pool was a major plus. So incredible to be able to see the Empire State Building while tanning! Gym was top-notch, and the location is perfect. It's just a cool vibe with good service. I would never stay anywhere else again. You are within walking distance to Union Square, Midtown, Soho, etc. And last, but not least, the doormen were very cool - so helpful, and kind. Especially Danny (bellman/doorman) - ask for him, he'll totally make you feel like a VIP. He's just a sweet guy and very accomodating!
reviews.title: Never staying anywhere else in NYC but here!

aka: Gansevoort Park Avenue Hotel New York City
description: The Gansevoort Park Avenue offers 249 luxury rooms and remarkable suites, most with lofty ceilings, Juliet balconies, and five fixture bathrooms. The three-story atrium lobby showcases striking herringbone granite floors, an oversized fireplace, and dramatic aubergine chandeliers. There is a signature rooftop pool for sunbathing and city-escape daydreaming and a bi-level rooftop bar + lounge wonderland.
